result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T. SHOMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Eric T. SHOMAN was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric T. SHOMAN is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Eric T. SHOMAN was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Eric T. SHOMAN was found guilty of Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

JURY TRIAL - Day 2
State files an Amended Information to correct the dates of violation to between 01-07-14 and 01-08-14 to conform to the testimony in the record.  
Testimony continued. 
Exhibit 9A, package baggie with marijuana shake.
Exhibit 14A, marijuana grinder.
Exhibit 14B, glass pot pipe.
Exhibit 8A, smoking device.
Exhbiit 8B, smoking device.
Exhibit 8C, smoking device.
Exhibit 8D, water bong.
Exhibit 8E, gas mask smoking device.
Exhibit 30, photograph in apartment.
Exhibit 13A, smoking device.
Exhibit 13B, smoking device.
Exhibit 13C, smoking device.
Exhibit 13D, smoking device. 
Exhibit 10A, empty plastic baggie. 
Exhibit 10B, SD memory card.
Exhibit 10C, small bag.
Exhibit 9B, baggie from bathroom.
Exhibit 9C, baggie from bathroom.
Exhibit 8F, smoking device.
Exhibit 8G. tall clear glass smoking device.
Exhibit 31, US currency seized.
Exhibit List.
During instruction conference there was a question regarding the pronunciation of a witnesses name.  Defense counsel would like a question presented to the jury asking them if anyone recognized any of the witnesses to let the jury bailiff know.  Court drafts the question and presents it to the jury.  
Jury Instructions.  
At 4:01 p.m. jury retires for deliberations.  
At 5:05 p.m. jury has reached a verdict.  Court reviews the verdicts and due to a conflict excuses the jury.  Counsel agree to present a question to the jury due to the conflicting verdicts.  DID THE JURY FIND THE DEFENDANT GUILTY OF POSSESS THC WITH INTENT TO DELIVER?  YES OR NO.
Counsel agree to all contraband being turned over to Officer Laabs and returned to the Manitowoc Police Department.  All photographs and reports will stay with the file. 
Exhibits 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, and 31 turned over to Officer Laabs.  
The question is returned with the answer NO, they did not find the defendant guilty of possess THC with intent to deliver.  
Court reads the verdicts into the record.  Guilty to Posses THC and Guilty to Possess drug paraphernalia.  
State moves for judgment of conviction on the verdicts.  Court enters convictions.  
Sentencing hearing is set for 10-02-14 at 3:00 p.m.  
Minutes

Motion in Limine regarding video interview of defendant at City of Manitowoc PD.  Defense counsel is challenging that interview.  Court has not reviewed the video so he will take a break to review it at this time.  
Exhibit 1, video interview of defendant at City of Manitowoc PD.
Testimony given.  
Exhibit 2, Miranda warning form from first interview at apartment.
Exhibit 3, Miranda warning form from second interview at police department.  Counsel argue.  Court finds as to the first interview defendant understood Miranda and was willing to waive his rights.  Court will allow the statements made at the apartment to be admitted into evidence and the good cause exception has been met because the officers tried to record the interview but lost it.  As for the second interview, defendant again did freely waive his rights.  
State's Motion in Limine 1-6.  Defense has no objection.  Staet will talk to witnesses about convictions.  If defendant testifies he has two. 
Court grants sequestration with the exception of Officer Laabs allowing to remain to assist the State.  
Defense counsel's first Motion in Limine.  State has no objection to 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6.  The only issue is No.4  Defense counsel wishes to make a statement to the jury in opening that he is counsel that is in private practice but takes public defender appointments like this one.  State objects.  Court wil not permit that statement to be made.  If defendant is convicted and there is an appellate issue, it may be perceived as ineffective assistance of counsel.  
Defense counsel would also like to introduce a chart regarding the range of medicinal medical marijuana permissible in other states.  Court is not going to permit the chart to come in and denies the motion.
State puts final offer on the record so defendant is aware.  Defense counsel discusses the offer with his client and he rejects it.  Defendant wishes a jury trial.  
JURY TRIAL- Day One
Testimony presented.  Court adjourns for the evening to resume at 8:30 a.m. tomorrow.

Minutes.
RE:  Possess THC within 1000 feet of a park, on 01-07-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC within 1000 feet of park and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-13-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash.  Cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
